title: sleep-debt-tracker
description: Sleep-debt-tracker is a project built with TypeScript, JavaScript, CSS, and HTML designed to help users track and manage their sleep debt. This application allows for logging sleep hours, calculating accumulated sleep debt, and visualizing sleep patterns. The project serves as a practical demonstration of utilizing TypeScript in a front-end application.

title: next-voting
description: Next-voting is a project built with TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript, focusing on creating a streamlined and modern voting platform. This repository contains the source code for the platform, emphasizing a clean user interface and robust functionality for secure and transparent voting processes. It serves as a practical example of building a full-stack application with these technologies.

title: NextJs-Dashboard
description: NextJs-Dashboard is a project showcasing a modern and responsive dashboard implementation using Next.js, leveraging the power of TypeScript for type safety, CSS for styling, and JavaScript for dynamic functionality. This repository serves as a practical example for building interactive user interfaces and exploring best practices in front-end development.

title: resume
description: This repository houses my resume, meticulously crafted using LaTeX for a professional and visually appealing presentation. It serves as a project demonstrating my ability to use LaTeX for document creation and showcases my skills and experience in a structured and easily readable format.

title: Map-Visualisation
description: Map-Visualisation is a project demonstrating how to create interactive map visualizations using HTML and Python. This repository contains code and resources for building and customizing maps to display data, geographical features, or any spatial information. It serves as a starting point for learning and experimenting with map-based data representation.

title: next-idea-board
description: Next-idea-board is a project built using TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript, designed as a dynamic idea board for brainstorming and organizing thoughts. This repository provides a platform to capture, categorize, and prioritize ideas in a visual and interactive manner, fostering collaboration and effective project management.

title: jovian
description: The `jovian` repository is a Python-based web application project utilizing Flask, PostgreSQL, HTML, CSS, and shell scripting to implement a CRUD (Create, Read, Update, Delete) application. This project serves as a practical example for learning and implementing web development with Python, demonstrating the integration of database management, backend logic, and frontend design principles.

title: genietalks
description: GenieTalks is a project leveraging TypeScript, CSS, JavaScript, HTML, Express.js, and Vite.js to build a user interface that interacts with the Gemini API. This repository showcases a practical application of these technologies for a complete project integrating frontend and backend elements for AI-powered communication.

title: finance-with-python
description: This repository contains a collection of Jupyter Notebooks and Python scripts exploring various finance-related projects. It serves as a practical resource for applying Python programming to financial analysis, modeling, and data visualization. The projects cover diverse topics within finance and provide hands-on experience using relevant Python libraries and techniques.

title: robofleet-dashboard
description: robofleet-dashboard is a web-based interface designed to visualize and interact with data from the Robofleet robotics platform. Built using JavaScript, Python, HTML, and CSS, this project provides a user-friendly dashboard for monitoring robot status, sensor readings, and other critical information. Its primary focus is on facilitating project-related visualizations and offering tools for effective robot fleet management.

title: atg-world
description: atg-world is a project built using TypeScript, JavaScript, HTML, and CSS. This repository serves as the central location for code related to the project, encompassing its front-end structure, dynamic scripting, and styling, all organized under the broader topic of general project development.

title: iot-asset-tracking
description: iot-asset-tracking is a web application built with Next.js, TypeScript, and Tailwind CSS to track and manage IoT assets. Leveraging Supabase for backend services, this project provides a user-friendly interface for monitoring asset location, status, and other relevant data, showcasing a modern approach to IoT management with a focus on clean code and efficient performance.

title: dynamic-event-calendar
description: dynamic-event-calendar is a project utilizing JavaScript, CSS, and HTML to create a dynamic and interactive event calendar. This repository provides a customizable calendar component capable of displaying and managing events, offering a user-friendly interface for scheduling and viewing important dates.

title: ros-log-viewer
description: ros-log-viewer is a web-based tool designed to visualize and analyze ROS (Robot Operating System) log files. Built using a combination of JavaScript, Python, HTML, and CSS for the frontend, alongside Python scripts for backend processing and log parsing, this project aims to provide an intuitive interface for understanding ROS system behavior. The repository falls under the "project" topic, serving as a practical implementation for improving ROS debugging and analysis workflows.

This project, built with TypeScript, JavaScript, CSS, and HTML, explores key concepts within the 'project' topic. It serves as a practical implementation and demonstration of web development techniques, showcasing how these languages can be combined to create a functional and engaging application.
